alert.note: Alert for Tusas Mountains Including Chama (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued November 23 at 3:58AM MST until November 25 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations over 10 inches possible, except for lighter amounts of a few inches along the Highway 285 corridor. * WHERE...Tusas Mountains Including Chama. * WHEN...From Friday afternoon through Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Some roads may be closed. Significant travel delays are possible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall is expected Friday night when south and southwest wind gusts up to 40 mph will produce areas of blowing and drifting snow. The visibility may drop below one quarter mile at times.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
